intro: Heterostemma barikianum, commonly known as the Madagascar star vine, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its climbing habit and distinctive star-shaped flowers. The plant features opposite, elliptical leaves with a glossy surface and produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale pink. Heterostemma barikianum is often found in humid, shaded environments within the rainforest understory. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after plant in horticulture, though it is relatively rare in cultivation.
